glimmer noun [C]
(SIGN)
a slight sign of something good or positive: glimmer of hope This month's sales figures offer a glimmer of hope for the depressed economy.glimmer of interest She's never shown a glimmer of interest in classical music.glimmer of light The first glimmer of light (= sign of development or understanding) has appeared in the peace talks.

(of light) to shine without strength or not continuously: A candle glimmered faintly in the darkened room.
a weak light that does not shine continuously : a glimmer of light
A glimmer is also a slight sign: The treaty offered a glimmer of hope to the region.
